definition: to concentrate
to pierce through/to pass through/to be stringed together/string of 1000 cash
to inject/to pour into/to concentrate/to pay attention/stake (gambling)/classifier for sums of money/variant of 註|注[zhu4]
to register/to annotate/note/comment
to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention

sentences.english: Non-action is the total attention of observation.
sentences.chinese: 不行动是全神贯注的观察。

sentences.english: The insurgents, all intent on the attack, which was imminent, had their backs turned to these two.
sentences.chinese: 起义者对即将到来的猛攻全神贯注，身子都转了过去。

sentences.english: They are playing card wholeheartedly, with the door open.
sentences.chinese: 他们正在全神贯注地打牌，门还开着呢。

sentences.english: He concentrated his attention on the question of technology.
sentences.chinese: 他将注意力全都贯注在技术问题上。

sentences.english: Whenever you tell Jonny some gossip， he’s all ears.
sentences.chinese: 每当你见闲话给给琼尼听时，他总是全神贯注。

sentences.english: The student always hangs on the professor's every word.
sentences.chinese: 那个学生总是全神贯注于教授的每句话。

sentences.english: He set straight the fluffy shade on the unlighted lamp.
sentences.chinese: 他全神贯注地整理那盏没有点亮的灯上的绒毛灯罩。

sentences.english: They are too engrossed to talk.
sentences.chinese: 她们全神贯注一声不吭。

sentences.english: He always pays full attention to what his teacher says in class.
sentences.chinese: 他总是全神贯注于老师上课时说的话。
约翰正在全神贯注地阅读。

sentences.english: Concentration on this life can at least temporally make me forget about death.
sentences.chinese: 用，全神贯注于这一生至少使我暂时忘却了死亡。

sentences.english: With her simple tools, Wang can draw attentively for a whole day.
sentences.chinese: 几件简单的工具，王月可以全神贯注地画上一天。

sentences.english: Qi and blood in the meridians circulate in cycles.
sentences.chinese: 经脉中的气血运行是循环贯注的，如环无端。

sentences.english: But what must be clear is that living less than wholeheartedly simply isn’t worth it.
sentences.chinese: 但必须清楚的是，生活不仅仅是全神贯注那么简单。

sentences.english: We could not concentrate on the lesson because the room was noisy.
sentences.chinese: 屋里太吵，我们无法全神贯注地听课。

sentences.english: The worker was beset on repairing the computer.
sentences.chinese: 这名工人全神贯注地在修理电脑。

definition: to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
to concentrate one's attention/to be fully focused
variant of 全神貫注|全神贯注[quan2 shen2 guan4 zhu4]
with rapt attention
to pour into/perfusion (med.)/to concentrate one's attention on/to teach/to inculcate/to instill
to give attention to sth/please give (some of your valuable) attention to my task/to be distracted
to concentrate entirely on sth/fully engaged/with full force
to concentrate/to think what you're doing
mind/state of mind/attention/(Chinese medicine) psychic constitution
hold one's breath
completely
to concentrate/to gather/(biology) to agglutinate
completely/absolutely/undivided/totally mixed up/muddled
variant of 凝練|凝练[ning2 lian4]
to merge together (idiom); to unify disparate elements into one whole
force/strength
